ygData.subject: RE: Disenchant and Antimagic Songs
ygData.msgSnippet: A couple of things that might have been discussed before but I don t remember so throwing it out again just in case. In reference to the level 22 song, it
ygData.messageBody:
A couple of things that might have been discussed before but I don't remember so
throwing it out again just in case.

In reference to the level 22 song, it doesn't remove negative spell effects cast
on you either when sung or with the lute equipped. In my testings, I have tried
this by just clicking on the song button. I get the static pulse message but
nothing else. What I have not tried is targetting myself (hitting F1 key or
click on my name) and then hitting the song button. Has anyone tried playing
this song with targetting themselves first?

One other possibility. Are we 100% certain that the song is supposed to remove
negative buffs from us? What if the song removes positive buffs from a mob?

As a last resort, we could always send a message to Geoffrey Zatkin and try to
get clarification from him for both songs.

Once again, if these possibilities have already been covered then my bad.

Galtin of E'ci



> i still haven't tried the level 40 song since it was fixed, keep forgetting.
> i have heard that it is a single target dispel magic song, removing one icon
> per tick. perhaps the level 22 song is a preventative song, meaning you
> must be playing it to avoid getting charmed, as opposed to playing it after
> a group member is charmed. maybe get two bards (one level 22+ the other
> level 28+) and one other person together. have the level 22+ bard and 3rd
> person group, and have the level 28+ bard alone and try to charm both people
> in the group while the 22+ bard sings level 22 disenchanting melody and see
> if charm works. i'm either too lazy or more likely will forget to try this
> =)
>
> Shada D'ukal, Level 50 Wood Elf Bard
> Erisi Dlarit, Level 23 High Elf Paladin
> Tyria, Level 17 High Elf Wizard
> Mithaniel Marr Server
>
> > Greeting fellow Bards,
> > I was under the impression that the Antimagic Song was an AOE
> > or party only
> > that prevented harmful spells from being cast on the party by
> > any attacking
> > mobs. I watched my husband and his group in beta attack the
> > Karanas Ogre
> > camp and they specifically had a L40+ bard to sing this song
> > to prevent
> > members from being charmed.
> > I tried Disenchant last night after a group member was rez'ed
> > and it did not
> > dispell the Rez effect. It was effecting my whole party but
> > no one reported
> > losing any buffs.
> > Is it possible the Disenchanting song and the Antimagic song
> > effects have
> > been completely switched in the multitude of patches and
> > tweaks/nerfs since
> > beta?
> >
> > Just wondering out Loud,
> >
> > Lady Brilinnia Ban'Sidhe
> > Knight Marshall, Order of the Rose
> > Excalibur, (Xegony L33)
> >
>
